related.meaning: dengan susah payah, dengan susah payah, yang telah lama ditunggu-tunggu
pada saat itu, pada hari-hari itu (sama dengan そのころ)

lessons.japanese: わたしたちはみな、時折ばかな真似をする。
lessons.indonesian: We all make fools of ourselves at times.

lessons.japanese: 時折クラブで彼に会います。
lessons.indonesian: I meet him on occasion at the club.

lessons.japanese: 彼とは時折クラブで会う。
lessons.indonesian: I meet him on occasion at the club.

lessons.japanese: そう言う事故は時折起こり得る事だ。
lessons.indonesian: Such accidents can happen from time to time.

lessons.japanese: 時折クラブで彼に会います。
lessons.indonesian: I meet him on occasion at the club.

lessons.japanese: 時折クラブで彼に会います。
lessons.indonesian: I sometimes meet him at the club.

lessons.japanese: 時折クラブで彼に会います。
lessons.indonesian: I occasionally meet him at the club.

lessons.japanese: 彼女は時折ワインを少し飲む。
lessons.indonesian: She drinks a little wine at times.

lessons.japanese: 彼は時折腕時計をちらりと見た。
lessons.indonesian: He glanced at his wristwatch now and then.

lessons.japanese: 彼は時折母親に手紙を書く。
lessons.indonesian: He writes to his mother every now and then.

lessons.japanese: 彼は今でも時折訪ねてくる。
lessons.indonesian: He still comes to see me now and then.

lessons.japanese: 彼は今でも時折小説を書いているが、以前ほどではない。
lessons.indonesian: He still writes novels from time to time, but not as often as he used to.

lessons.japanese: 彼は、時折海辺に行くことが好きです。
lessons.indonesian: He likes to go to the beach now and then.
